action.name: core.create
action.title: Items/Categories (inherited): create
action.description: Allow users in the group to CREATE new Items/Categories in any category. NOTE: You can explicitely deny per category/item. but if set to deny here, you cann't expicitely allow per category/item.

action.name: core.edit.state

action.description: Allow users in the group to EDIT the PUBLICATION STATE of OWNED Items/Categories in any category. NOTE: You can explicitely deny per category/item, but if set to deny here, you cann't expicitely allow per category/item.

action.name: core.delete

action.name: flexicontent.change.cat
action.title: Items (Item edit Form): change category assignment
action.description: Allow users in the group to change the categories assigned to an item (after the item has been created). NOTE: You can explicitely deny per category/item, but if set to deny here, you cann't expicitely allow per category/item.

action.name: flexicontent.change.cat.sec
action.title: Items (Item edit Form): change secondary category assignments
action.description: Allow users in the group to change the categories assigned to an item (after the item has been created). NOTE: You can explicitely deny per category/item, but if set to deny here, you cann't expicitely allow per category/item.

action.name: flexicontent.change.cat.feat
action.title: Items (Item edit Form): change featured category assignments

action.name: flexicontent.accesslevel
action.title: Items/Categories (Global Only): Set Access Level
action.description: Allow users in the group to set the Access Level of items / categories that they can edit

action.name: flexicontent.displayallitems
action.title: Items (Backend Tab): Display all
action.description:
Allow users in the group to list all Items (in items management), otherwise the user will only see the items that he/she can view (has ACCESS Level to view them in frontend).
Also this setting maybe used in other cases, like in quick access listins of FLEXIcontent Dashboard (revised, newly created, etc items). Users that do not have this privilege will be limit to view only the items that they own.

action.name: flexicontent.copyitems
action.title: Items (Backend Tab): Copy Task
action.description: Allow users in the group to use the Item Copy Task (in items management)

action.name: flexicontent.orderitems
action.title: Items (Backend Tab): Reorder
action.description: Allow users in the group to change the ordering of items (in items management)

action.name: flexicontent.paramsitem
action.title: Items (Item edit Form): set params
action.description: Allow users in the group to change the parameters of editable items.

action.name: flexicontent.versioning

action.description: Allow users in the group to use multiple Versions per Item

action.name: flexicontent.assocanytrans
action.title: Items (Item edit Form): associate any translation

action.name: flexicontent.editcreationdate
action.title: Items (Item edit Form): edit creation date
action.description: Allow users in the group to edit creation date of an item. NOTE that is usually reserved for administrator since creation date might be important for subscription sites and other site behavior

action.name: flexicontent.ignoreviewstate
action.title: Items (Frontend Content Lists): ignore view state
action.description: Allow users in the group to view unpublished, archived, trashed, scheduled, expired items in frontend content lists e.g. category view. NOTE normally only item owners and super admins can view such items

action.name: flexicontent.managecats
action.title: Categories: -- manage --
action.description: Allow users in the group to have access to the Category Management. NOTE: the inherited privileges of each category are in effect. Thus the user can only perform specific actions on specific categories

action.name: flexicontent.usercats

action.name: flexicontent.viewtree

action.name: flexicontent.multicat
action.title: Categories (Item edit Form): Assign multiple categories to items
action.description: Allow users in the group to assign multiple categories to items. If lacking this privelege, the secondary category selector will be disabled. NOTE: user will still need to have 'create' privilege in these categories
